metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9796 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability can occur when the SMIL animation controller incorrectly registers with the refresh driver twice when only a single registration is expected. When a registration is later freed with the removal of the animation controller element, the refresh driver incorrectly leaves a dangling pointer to the driver's observer array. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.6, Firefox ESR < 60.6, and Firefox < 66.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9796` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '66.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
